question: [File: state-sync/data-streaming-service/src/error.rs] [Enum: Error] [Error information leakage] The error variants contain detailed String messages. Can these leak sensitive information about internal state to clients? (Low)

[File: state-sync/data-streaming-service/src/error.rs] [Function: get_label()] [Metrics label stability] Error labels are used for metrics. If error messages change, do metric labels remain stable for monitoring? (Low)

[File: state-sync/data-streaming-service/src/error.rs] [Trait: From<aptos_data_client::error::Error>] [Error context loss] At line 42-45, the conversion to Error::AptosDataClientError only preserves the String representation. Is context like error source lost? (Low)

[File: state-sync/data-streaming-service/src/dynamic_prefetching.rs] [Function: new()] [Initial value validation] At line 34-36, initial_prefetching_value is read from config without validation. Can setting this to 0 or u64::MAX cause issues? (Medium)

[File: state-sync/data-streaming-service/src/dynamic_prefetching.rs] [Function: is_prefetching_value_frozen()] [Time comparison] At line 62-77, time_since_last_failure is compared to max_freeze_duration. If the TimeService clock goes backward, can this comparison fail? (Low)

[File: state-sync/data-streaming-service/src/dynamic_prefetching.rs] [Function: get_max_concurrent_requests()] [State vs subscription override] At line 86-99, StateStreamEngine uses max_concurrent_state_requests while others use max_concurrent_requests. Can this inconsistency cause performance issues or DoS? (Low)

[File: state-sync/data-streaming-service/src/dynamic_prefetching.rs] [Function: increase_max_concurrent_requests()] [Unbounded growth prevention] At line 109-126, the value is bounded by max_prefetching_value. If max_prefetching_value is set extremely high, can the increase cause resource exhaustion? (Medium)

[File: state-sync/data-streaming-service/src/dynamic_prefetching.rs] [Function: decrease_max_concurrent_requests()] [Minimum bound] At line 130-150, the value is bounded by min_prefetching_value. If min_prefetching_value is 0, can this stop all requests? (High)

[File: state-sync/data-streaming-service/src/streaming_service.rs] [Async: start_service() loop] [Tokio task spawn] At line 121-125, spawn_global_data_summary_refresher() creates an infinite async task. If this panics, is it properly restarted or does it silently fail? (High)

[File: state-sync/data-streaming-service/src/data_stream.rs] [Async: send_data_notification()] [Backpressure handling] At line 404, send() can block if the channel is full. Does this properly propagate backpressure or can it cause deadlocks? (High)

[File: state-sync/data-streaming-service/src/data_stream.rs] [Concurrency: PendingClientResponse] [Arc<Mutex<Box<...>>>] The pending response uses Arc<Mutex<Box<T>>>. Is this triple-wrapping necessary? Can simplified locking reduce contention? (Low)

[File: state-sync/data-streaming-service/src/data_stream.rs] [Resource: spawned_tasks] [Task cleanup] At line 92-94, spawned_tasks tracks JoinHandles. If tasks complete normally, are handles removed from the vec or does it grow unbounded? (Medium)

[File: state-sync/data-streaming-service/src/streaming_service.rs] [Resource: data_streams HashMap] [Memory leak] If streams are created but never terminated (due to bugs), does the HashMap grow unbounded causing memory leak? (High)

[File: state-sync/data-streaming-service/src/streaming_service.rs] [Function: handle_stream_request_message()] [Response sender failure] At line 190-197, if response_sender.send() fails, only a warning is logged. Can this cause the client to hang waiting for a response that never arrives? (Medium)

[File: state-sync/data-streaming-service/src/data_stream.rs] [Function: process_data_responses()] [Sanity check bypass] At line 470, sanity_check_client_response_type() is called. If this function has logic errors, can malformed responses bypass validation? (Critical)

[File: state-sync/data-streaming-service/src/stream_engine.rs] [Function: verify_client_request_indices()] [Index boundary] Is this function checking for integer overflow when comparing indices? Can manipulated indices cause buffer overruns? (High)

[File: state-sync/data-streaming-service/src/stream_engine.rs] [Function: create_data_client_request_batch()] [Batch size limit] When creating batches of requests, is there a limit on total batch size? Can excessively large batches cause memory issues? (Medium)

[File: state-sync/data-streaming-service/src/data_stream.rs] [Function: send_end_of_stream_notification()] [Duplicate end notification] Can send_end_of_stream_notification() be called multiple times? If so, does this cause duplicate EndOfStream notifications? (Low)

[File: state-sync/data-streaming-service/src/streaming_service.rs] [Function: get_global_data_summary()] [ArcSwap race] At line 158-160, the global data summary is loaded from ArcSwap. Can rapid updates during this load cause torn reads? (Medium)

[File: state-sync/data-streaming-service/src/data_stream.rs] [Function: update_stream_version_and_epoch()] [Epoch transition handling] When updating version and epoch, are epoch boundaries properly validated? Can version be in one epoch while epoch field is in another? (High)

[File: state-sync/data-streaming-service/src/stream_engine.rs] [Function: extract_new_versions_and_target()] [Response payload parsing] When extracting versions from ResponsePayload, is the payload structure validated? Can malformed payloads cause panics? (High)

[File: state-sync/data-streaming-service/src/data_stream.rs] [Function: create_missing_data_request()] [Missing data detection] How is 'missing data' detected? Can an attacker craft responses that look complete but trigger unnecessary missing data requests? (Medium)

[File: state-sync/data-streaming-service/src/stream_engine.rs] [Function: bound_by_range()] [Range bounding logic] When bounding values to a range, is the logic correct for all edge cases (equal bounds, inverted bounds, etc.)? (Low)

[File: state-sync/data-streaming-service/src/streaming_service.rs] [Config: STREAM_PROGRESS_UPDATE_CHANNEL_SIZE] [Channel capacity] This is set to 1 with LIFO queue style. Can this cause notification loss under high load? (Medium)

[File: state-sync/data-streaming-service/src/streaming_client.rs] [Trait: DataStreamingClient] [Async trait] The trait is async. Are all implementations properly Send + Sync for concurrent use? Can trait methods be called concurrently causing race conditions? (Medium)
